required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: An Observational Study to Assess the Effect of Cumulative Ribavirin Dose in Participants With Chronic Hepatitis C

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this open-label, non-randomized, single-arm, multicentre observational study is to investigate the influence of the cumulative dose (total administered dose/ planned dose) of ribavirin on the sustained virologic response (SVR) in participants who have been receiving combination therapy with pegylated interferon alfa-2a (Pegasys) and ribavirin (Copegus).

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Achieving Sustained Virological Response (SVR) According to Cumulative Dose of Ribavirin
primary_outcome.time_frame: 24 weeks after EOT (maximum up to 96 Weeks)
primary_outcome.description: Determination of hepatitis C virus (HCV) titers was performed using COBAS AmpliPrep/COBAS TaqMan HCV technique, upon decision of the treating physician and respecting the therapeutic protocol for the treatment of hepatitis C, at Weeks 4, 12 and 24 of the treatment period (and, optionally, at the end of treatment [EOT] visit), and at the end of the 24-week follow-up period. Negative HCV titers measured at Weeks 4, 12, 24, and at EOT were interpreted as virological response, and negative HCV titers measured at the end of the 24-week follow-up period were interpreted as SVR. Percentage of participants achieving SVR in each cumulative dose group is presented. Cumulative dose was calculated as: (administered dose divided by planned dose) multiplied by 100.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Virologic Response
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Week 4, 12, 24 and at EOT (maximum up to 72 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: Determination of HCV titers was performed by using the COBAS AmpliPrep/COBAS TaqMan HCV technique, upon decision of the treating physician and respecting the therapeutic protocol for the treatment of hepatitis C. Negative HCV titers measured at Weeks 4, 12, 24 and at EOT were interpreted as virological response.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Virologic Response According to Starting Dose of Ribavirin
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to EOT (maximum up to 72 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: Determination of HCV titers was performed by using the COBAS AmpliPrep/COBAS TaqMan HCV technique, upon decision of the treating physician and respecting the therapeutic protocol for the treatment of hepatitis C. Negative HCV titers measured at Weeks 4, 12, 24 and at EOT were interpreted as virological response. Percentage of participants achieving virological response in each dose group is presented.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With SVR According to Starting Dose of Ribavirin
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 24 weeks after EOT (maximum up to 96 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: Determination of HCV titers was performed by using the COBAS AmpliPrep/COBAS TaqMan HCV technique, upon decision of the treating physician and respecting the therapeutic protocol for the treatment of hepatitis C. Negative HCV titers measured at Weeks 4, 12, 24, and at EOT were interpreted as virological response, and negative HCV titers measured at the end of the 24-week follow-up period were interpreted as SVR. Percentage of participants achieving SVR in each dose group is presented.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Virologic Response According to Body Weight-normalized Dose of Ribavirin
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to EOT (maximum up to 72 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: Determination of HCV titers was performed by using the COBAS AmpliPrep/COBAS TaqMan HCV technique, upon decision of the treating physician and respecting the therapeutic protocol for the treatment of hepatitis C. Negative HCV titers measured at Weeks 4, 12, 24, and at EOT were interpreted as virological response. Percentage of participants achieving virological response in each body weight-normalized (measured in milligram per kilogram per day [mg/kg/day]) dose group is presented.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With SVR According to Body Weight-normalized Dose of Ribavirin
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 24 weeks after EOT (maximum up to 96 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: Determination of HCV titers was performed by using the COBAS AmpliPrep/COBAS TaqMan HCV technique, upon decision of the treating physician and respecting the therapeutic protocol for the treatment of hepatitis C. Negative HCV titers measured at Weeks 4, 12, 24, and at EOT were interpreted as virological response, and negative HCV titers measured at the end of the 24-week follow-up period were interpreted as SVR. Percentage of participants achieving SVR in each body weight-normalized dose group is presented.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Virologic Response According to Dose Reduction of Ribavirin
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to EOT (maximum up to 72 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: Determination of HCV titers was performed by using the COBAS AmpliPrep/COBAS TaqMan HCV technique, upon decision of the treating physician and respecting the therapeutic protocol for the treatment of hepatitis C. Negative HCV titers measured at Weeks 4, 12, 24, and at EOT were interpreted as virological response. Percentage of participants achieving virological response in each dose-reduction group (none, dose reduction within 12 weeks, dose reduction after 12 weeks, dose reduction not specified) is presented.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With SVR According to Dose Reduction of Ribavirin
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 24 weeks after EOT (maximum up to 96 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: Determination of HCV titers was performed by using the COBAS AmpliPrep/COBAS TaqMan HCV technique, upon decision of the treating physician and respecting the therapeutic protocol for the treatment of hepatitis C. Negative HCV titers measured at Weeks 4, 12, 24 and at EOT were interpreted as virological response, and negative HCV titers measured at the end of the 24-week follow-up period were interpreted as SVR. Percentage of participants achieving SVR in each dose-reduction group (none, dose reduction within 12 weeks, dose reduction after 12 weeks, dose reduction not specified) is presented.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Virologic Response According to Interleukin-28B (IL-28B) Polymorphism
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to EOT (maximum up to 72 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: Determination of HCV titers was performed by using the COBAS AmpliPrep/COBAS TaqMan HCV technique, upon decision of the treating physician and respecting the therapeutic protocol for the treatment of hepatitis C. Negative HCV titers measured at Weeks 4, 12, 24 and at EOT were interpreted as virological response. Percentage of participants achieving virological response for each IL-28B allele (CC allele, CT allele, TT allele) is presented.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With SVR According to IL-28B Polymorphism
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 24 weeks after EOT (maximum up to 96 Weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: Determination of HCV titers was performed by using the COBAS AmpliPrep/COBAS TaqMan HCV technique, upon decision of the treating physician and respecting the therapeutic protocol for the treatment of hepatitis C. Negative HCV titers measured at Weeks 4, 12, 24 and at EOT were interpreted as virological response, and negative HCV titers measured at the end of the 24-week follow-up period were interpreted as SVR. Percentage of participants achieving SVR for each IL-28B allele (CC allele, CT allele, TT allele) is presented.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Viral Relapse or Breakthrough
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 24 weeks after EOT (maximum up to 96 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: Determination of HCV titers was performed by using the COBAS AmpliPrep/COBAS TaqMan HCV technique, upon decision of the treating physician and respecting the therapeutic protocol for the treatment of hepatitis C. In participants with virological response, positive HCV titers measured during 24-week follow-up was interpreted as viral relapse, and positive HCV titers measured during the treatment period was interpreted as viral breakthrough. Percentage of participants with no relapse/breakthrough (none), with relapse, and with breakthrough is reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Viral Relapse or Breakthrough According to Cumulative Dose of Ribavirin
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 24 weeks after EOT (maximum up to 96 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: Determination of HCV titers was performed by using the COBAS AmpliPrep/COBAS TaqMan HCV technique, upon decision of the treating physician and respecting the therapeutic protocol for the treatment of hepatitis C. In participants with virological response, positive HCV titers measured during 24-week follow-up was interpreted as viral relapse, and positive HCV titers measured during the treatment period was interpreted as viral breakthrough. Percentage of participants with viral relapse or breakthrough in each cumulative dose group is presented. Cumulative dose was calculated as: (administered dose divided by planned dose) multiplied by 100. Percentage of participants with no relapse/breakthrough (none), with relapse, and with breakthrough in each cumulative dose group (<60%, 60-69%, 70-79%, 80-89%, and >90%) is reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Viral Relapse or Breakthrough According to Starting Dose of Ribavirin
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Week 4, 12, 24, at EOT Visit, 24 weeks after EOT (maximum up to 96 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: Determination of HCV titers was performed by using the COBAS AmpliPrep/COBAS TaqMan HCV technique, upon decision of the treating physician and respecting the therapeutic protocol for the treatment of hepatitis C. In participants with virological response, positive HCV titers measured during 24-week follow-up was interpreted as viral relapse, and positive HCV titers measured during the treatment period was interpreted as viral breakthrough. Percentage of participants with no relapse/breakthrough (none), with relapse, and with breakthrough in each dose group (600 mg, 800 mg, 1000 mg, 1200 mg, and 1400 mg) is presented.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Viral Relapse or Breakthrough According to Body Weight-normalized Dose of Ribavirin
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 24 weeks after EOT (maximum up to 96 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: Determination of HCV titers was performed by using the COBAS AmpliPrep/COBAS TaqMan HCV technique, upon decision of the treating physician and respecting the therapeutic protocol for the treatment of hepatitis C. In participants with virological response, positive HCV titers measured during 24-week follow-up was interpreted as viral relapse, and positive HCV titers measured during the treatment period was interpreted as viral breakthrough. Percentage of participants with no relapse/breakthrough (none), with relapse, and with breakthrough in each body weight-normalized dose group (<5mg/kg/day, 5-10 mg/kg/day, 10-15 mg/kg/day, 15-20 mg/kg/day, and >20 mg/kg/day) is presented.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Viral Relapse or Breakthrough According to Dose Reduction of Ribavirin
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 24 weeks after EOT (maximum up to 96 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: Determination of HCV titers was performed by using the COBAS AmpliPrep/COBAS TaqMan HCV technique, upon decision of the treating physician and respecting the therapeutic protocol for the treatment of hepatitis C. In participants with virological response, positive HCV titers measured during 24-week follow-up was interpreted as viral relapse, and positive HCV titers measured during the treatment period was interpreted as viral breakthrough. Percentage of participants with no relapse/breakthrough (none), with relapse, and with breakthrough in each dose-reduction group (none, dose reduction within 12 weeks, dose reduction after 12 weeks, dose reduction not specified) is presented.

arm_group.description: Treatment naive participants with confirmed chronic hepatitis C who are started on combined Pegasys-Copegus treatment in accordance with current guidelines and SPCs, and whose treatment has been approved by the Interferon Committee.

intervention.description: Participants received pegylated interferon subcutaneous injection in accordance with current guidelines and SPCs.P
Participants received ribavirin 200 mg film-coated tablet in accordance with current guidelines and SPCs.

study_pop.textblock: Treatment naive participants with confirmed chronic hepatitis C who are started on combined Pegasys-Copegus treatment in accordance with current guidelines and SPCs, and whose treatment has been approved by the Interferon Committee.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Participants with serologically confirmed chronic hepatitis C
- Participants using and accepting a double method of contraception
Exclusion Criteria:
- Participants not approved by the national treatment guideline or the Interferon Committee for combined pegylated interferon-ribavirin treatment
- Contraindications in the summary of product characteristics of pegylated interferon alpha-2a and ribavirin
- Participants previously treated with pegylated interferon and/or ribavirin
- Hepatitis B and Human Immunodeficiency Virus co-infections

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Out of 697 participants enrolled in the study, only 693 participants provided evaluable data. One participant did not receive peginterferon alfa-2a/ribavirin combination therapy, while 3 participants received combination therapy only for a very short time.

group.title: Peginterferon Alfa-2a + Ribavirin
group.description: Treatment naive participants with confirmed chronic hepatitis C who started combination therapy with peginterferon alfa 2a (Pegasys) and ribavirin (Copegus) in accordance with current guidelines and summary of product characteristics, upon decision of the treating physician, considering each participant’s individual response, received combination therapy for 24, 48 or 72 weeks, followed by a 24-week follow-up period.

baseline.population: Intention-to-treat (ITT) population included all enrolled participants who provided evaluable data for the study.

group.title: Peginterferon Alfa-2a + Ribavirin
group.description: Treatment naive participants with confirmed chronic hepatitis C who started combination therapy with peginterferon alfa 2a and ribavirin in accordance with current guidelines and summary of product characteristics, upon decision of the treating physician, considering each participant’s individual response, received combination therapy for 24, 48 or 72 weeks, followed by a 24-week follow-up period.

measure.title: Age
measure.description: Out of total 693 participants in ITT population, data for only 692 participants was available for this baseline measure.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants Achieving Sustained Virological Response (SVR) According to Cumulative Dose of Ribavirin
outcome.description: Determination of hepatitis C virus (HCV) titers was performed using COBAS AmpliPrep/COBAS TaqMan HCV technique, upon decision of the treating physician and respecting the therapeutic protocol for the treatment of hepatitis C, at Weeks 4, 12 and 24 of the treatment period (and, optionally, at the end of treatment [EOT] visit), and at the end of the 24-week follow-up period. Negative HCV titers measured at Weeks 4, 12, 24, and at EOT were interpreted as virological response, and negative HCV titers measured at the end of the 24-week follow-up period were interpreted as SVR. Percentage of participants achieving SVR in each cumulative dose group is presented. Cumulative dose was calculated as: (administered dose divided by planned dose) multiplied by 100.
outcome.time_frame: 24 weeks after EOT (maximum up to 96 Weeks)
outcome.population: ITT Population. Here, 'N' (number of participants analyzed) signifies the number of participants analyzed for this outcome measure and 'n' signifies the number of participants analyzed for specified category.

group.title: Peginterferon Alfa-2a + Ribavirin
group.description: Treatment naive participants with confirmed chronic hepatitis C who started combination therapy with peginterferon alfa 2a and ribavirin in accordance with current guidelines and summary of product characteristics, upon decision of the treating physician, considering each participant’s individual response, received combination therapy for 24, 48 or 72 weeks, followed by a 24-week follow-up period.

measure.description: Determination of hepatitis C virus (HCV) titers was performed using COBAS AmpliPrep/COBAS TaqMan HCV technique, upon decision of the treating physician and respecting the therapeutic protocol for the treatment of hepatitis C, at Weeks 4, 12 and 24 of the treatment period (and, optionally, at the end of treatment [EOT] visit), and at the end of the 24-week follow-up period. Negative HCV titers measured at Weeks 4, 12, 24, and at EOT were interpreted as virological response, and negative HCV titers measured at the end of the 24-week follow-up period were interpreted as SVR. measure.population: ITT Population. Here, 'N' (number of participants analyzed) signifies the number of participants analyzed for this outcome measure and 'n' signifies the number of participants analyzed for specified category.

analysis.groups_desc: Cumulative dose of ribavirin >90%: the relationship between cumulative dose and SVR response in participants in whom the cumulative dose of ribavirin exceeded 90% was analyzed using Chi-square test.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Virologic Response
outcome.description: Determination of HCV titers was performed by using the COBAS AmpliPrep/COBAS TaqMan HCV technique, upon decision of the treating physician and respecting the therapeutic protocol for the treatment of hepatitis C. Negative HCV titers measured at Weeks 4, 12, 24 and at EOT were interpreted as virological response.

group.title: Peginterferon Alfa-2a + Ribavirin
group.description: Treatment naive participants with confirmed chronic hepatitis C who started combination therapy with peginterferon alfa 2a and ribavirin in accordance with current guidelines and summary of product characteristics, upon decision of the treating physician, considering each participant’s individual response, received combination therapy for 24, 48 or 72 weeks, followed by a 24-week follow-up period.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With SVR According to IL-28B Polymorphism
measure.description: Determination of HCV titers was performed by using the COBAS AmpliPrep/COBAS TaqMan HCV technique, upon decision of the treating physician and respecting the therapeutic protocol for the treatment of hepatitis C. Negative HCV titers measured at Weeks 4, 12, 24 and at EOT were interpreted as virological response, and negative HCV titers measured at the end of the 24-week follow-up period were interpreted as SVR. Percentage of participants achieving SVR for each IL-28B allele (CC allele, CT allele, TT allele) is presented.
measure.population: ITT Population. Here, 'N' (number of participants analyzed) signifies the number of participants analyzed for this outcome measure and 'n' signifies the number of participants analyzed for specified category.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Viral Relapse or Breakthrough
outcome.description: Determination of HCV titers was performed by using the COBAS AmpliPrep/COBAS TaqMan HCV technique, upon decision of the treating physician and respecting the therapeutic protocol for the treatment of hepatitis C. In participants with virological response, positive HCV titers measured during 24-week follow-up was interpreted as viral relapse, and positive HCV titers measured during the treatment period was interpreted as viral breakthrough. Percentage of participants with no relapse/breakthrough (none), with relapse, and with breakthrough is reported.
outcome.time_frame: Up to 24 weeks after EOT (maximum up to 96 weeks)
outcome.population: ITT Population showing virological response. Here, 'N' (number of participants analyzed) signifies the number of participants analyzed for this outcome measure.

group.title: Peginterferon Alfa-2a + Ribavirin
group.description: Treatment naive participants with confirmed chronic hepatitis C who started combination therapy with peginterferon alfa 2a and ribavirin in accordance with current guidelines and summary of product characteristics, upon decision of the treating physician, considering each participant’s individual response, received combination therapy for 24, 48 or 72 weeks, followed by a 24-week follow-up period.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With Viral Relapse or Breakthrough
measure.description: Determination of HCV titers was performed by using the COBAS AmpliPrep/COBAS TaqMan HCV technique, upon decision of the treating physician and respecting the therapeutic protocol for the treatment of hepatitis C. In participants with virological response, positive HCV titers measured during 24-week follow-up was interpreted as viral relapse, and positive HCV titers measured during the treatment period was interpreted as viral breakthrough. Percentage of participants with no relapse/breakthrough (none), with relapse, and with breakthrough is reported.
measure.population: ITT Population showing virological response. Here, 'N' (number of participants analyzed) signifies the number of participants analyzed for this outcome measure.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Viral Relapse or Breakthrough According to Cumulative Dose of Ribavirin
outcome.description: Determination of HCV titers was performed by using the COBAS AmpliPrep/COBAS TaqMan HCV technique, upon decision of the treating physician and respecting the therapeutic protocol for the treatment of hepatitis C. In participants with virological response, positive HCV titers measured during 24-week follow-up was interpreted as viral relapse, and positive HCV titers measured during the treatment period was interpreted as viral breakthrough. Percentage of participants with viral relapse or breakthrough in each cumulative dose group is presented. Cumulative dose was calculated as: (administered dose divided by planned dose) multiplied by 100. Percentage of participants with no relapse/breakthrough (none), with relapse, and with breakthrough in each cumulative dose group (<60%, 60-69%, 70-79%, 80-89%, and >90%) is reported.
outcome.time_frame: Up to 24 weeks after EOT (maximum up to 96 weeks)
outcome.population: ITT Population showing virological response. Here, 'N' (number of participants analyzed) signifies the number of participants analyzed for this outcome measure.

group.title: Peginterferon Alfa-2a + Ribavirin
group.description: Treatment naive participants with confirmed chronic hepatitis C who started combination therapy with peginterferon alfa 2a and ribavirin in accordance with current guidelines and summary of product characteristics, upon decision of the treating physician, considering each participant’s individual response, received combination therapy for 24, 48 or 72 weeks, followed by a 24-week follow-up period.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With Viral Relapse or Breakthrough According to Cumulative Dose of Ribavirin
measure.description: Determination of HCV titers was performed by using the COBAS AmpliPrep/COBAS TaqMan HCV technique, upon decision of the treating physician and respecting the therapeutic protocol for the treatment of hepatitis C. In participants with virological response, positive HCV titers measured during 24-week follow-up was interpreted as viral relapse, and positive HCV titers measured during the treatment period was interpreted as viral breakthrough. Percentage of participants with viral relapse or breakthrough in each cumulative dose group is presented. Cumulative dose was calculated as: (administered dose divided by planned dose) multiplied by 100. Percentage of participants with no relapse/breakthrough (none), with relapse, and with breakthrough in each cumulative dose group (<60%, 60-69%, 70-79%, 80-89%, and >90%) is reported.
measure.population: ITT Population showing virological response. Here, 'N' (number of participants analyzed) signifies the number of participants analyzed for this outcome measure.

analysis.groups_desc: The relationship between the cumulative dose of ribavirin and relapse rate was analyzed using Chi-square test.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Viral Relapse or Breakthrough According to Starting Dose of Ribavirin
outcome.description: Determination of HCV titers was performed by using the COBAS AmpliPrep/COBAS TaqMan HCV technique, upon decision of the treating physician and respecting the therapeutic protocol for the treatment of hepatitis C. In participants with virological response, positive HCV titers measured during 24-week follow-up was interpreted as viral relapse, and positive HCV titers measured during the treatment period was interpreted as viral breakthrough. Percentage of participants with no relapse/breakthrough (none), with relapse, and with breakthrough in each dose group (600 mg, 800 mg, 1000 mg, 1200 mg, and 1400 mg) is presented.
outcome.time_frame: Week 4, 12, 24, at EOT Visit, 24 weeks after EOT (maximum up to 96 weeks)
outcome.population: ITT Population showing virological response. Here, 'N' (number of participants analyzed) signifies the number of participants analyzed for this outcome measure.

group.description: Treatment naive participants with confirmed chronic hepatitis C who started combination therapy with peginterferon alfa 2a and ribavirin in accordance with current guidelines and summary of product characteristics, upon decision of the treating physician, considering each participant’s individual response, received combination therapy for 24, 48 or 72 weeks, followed by a 24-week follow-up period.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With Viral Relapse or Breakthrough According to Starting Dose of Ribavirin
measure.description: Determination of HCV titers was performed by using the COBAS AmpliPrep/COBAS TaqMan HCV technique, upon decision of the treating physician and respecting the therapeutic protocol for the treatment of hepatitis C. In participants with virological response, positive HCV titers measured during 24-week follow-up was interpreted as viral relapse, and positive HCV titers measured during the treatment period was interpreted as viral breakthrough. Percentage of participants with no relapse/breakthrough (none), with relapse, and with breakthrough in each dose group (600 mg, 800 mg, 1000 mg, 1200 mg, and 1400 mg) is presented.
measure.population: ITT Population showing virological response. Here, 'N' (number of participants analyzed) signifies the number of participants analyzed for this outcome measure.

analysis.groups_desc: The relationship between the starting dose of ribavirin and relapse rate was analyzed using Chi-square test.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Viral Relapse or Breakthrough According to Body Weight-normalized Dose of Ribavirin
outcome.description: Determination of HCV titers was performed by using the COBAS AmpliPrep/COBAS TaqMan HCV technique, upon decision of the treating physician and respecting the therapeutic protocol for the treatment of hepatitis C. In participants with virological response, positive HCV titers measured during 24-week follow-up was interpreted as viral relapse, and positive HCV titers measured during the treatment period was interpreted as viral breakthrough. Percentage of participants with no relapse/breakthrough (none), with relapse, and with breakthrough in each body weight-normalized dose group (<5mg/kg/day, 5-10 mg/kg/day, 10-15 mg/kg/day, 15-20 mg/kg/day, and >20 mg/kg/day) is presented.
outcome.time_frame: Up to 24 weeks after EOT (maximum up to 96 weeks)
outcome.population: ITT Population showing virological response. Here, 'N' (number of participants analyzed) signifies the number of participants analyzed for this outcome measure.

group.title: Peginterferon Alfa-2a + Ribavirin
group.description: Treatment naive participants with confirmed chronic hepatitis C who started combination therapy with peginterferon alfa 2a and ribavirin in accordance with current guidelines and summary of product characteristics, upon decision of the treating physician, considering each participant’s individual response, received combination therapy for 24, 48 or 72 weeks, followed by a 24-week follow-up period.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With Viral Relapse or Breakthrough According to Body Weight-normalized Dose of Ribavirin
measure.description: Determination of HCV titers was performed by using the COBAS AmpliPrep/COBAS TaqMan HCV technique, upon decision of the treating physician and respecting the therapeutic protocol for the treatment of hepatitis C. In participants with virological response, positive HCV titers measured during 24-week follow-up was interpreted as viral relapse, and positive HCV titers measured during the treatment period was interpreted as viral breakthrough. Percentage of participants with no relapse/breakthrough (none), with relapse, and with breakthrough in each body weight-normalized dose group (<5mg/kg/day, 5-10 mg/kg/day, 10-15 mg/kg/day, 15-20 mg/kg/day, and >20 mg/kg/day) is presented.
measure.population: ITT Population showing virological response. Here, 'N' (number of participants analyzed) signifies the number of participants analyzed for this outcome measure.

analysis.groups_desc: The relationship between the body weight-normalized dose of ribavirin and relapse rate was analyzed using Chi-square test.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Viral Relapse or Breakthrough According to Dose Reduction of Ribavirin
outcome.description: Determination of HCV titers was performed by using the COBAS AmpliPrep/COBAS TaqMan HCV technique, upon decision of the treating physician and respecting the therapeutic protocol for the treatment of hepatitis C. In participants with virological response, positive HCV titers measured during 24-week follow-up was interpreted as viral relapse, and positive HCV titers measured during the treatment period was interpreted as viral breakthrough. Percentage of participants with no relapse/breakthrough (none), with relapse, and with breakthrough in each dose-reduction group (none, dose reduction within 12 weeks, dose reduction after 12 weeks, dose reduction not specified) is presented.
outcome.time_frame: Up to 24 weeks after EOT (maximum up to 96 weeks)
outcome.population: ITT Population showing virological response. Here, 'N' (number of participants analyzed) signifies the number of participants analyzed for this outcome measure.

In participants with virological response, positive HCV titers measured during 24-week follow-up was interpreted as viral relapse, and positive HCV titers measured during the treatment period was interpreted as viral breakthrough. Percentage of participants with no relapse/breakthrough (none), with relapse, and with breakthrough in each dose-reduction group (none, dose reduction within 12 weeks, dose reduction after 12 weeks, dose reduction not specified) is presented.

reported_events.desc: Safety population included all participants enrolled for the study.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The Study being conducted under this Agreement is part of the Overall Study. Investigator is free to publish in reputable journals or to present at professional conferences the results of the Study, but only after the first publication or presentation that involves the Overall Study. The Sponsor may request that Confidential Information be deleted and/or the publication be postponed in order to protect the Sponsor's intellectual property rights.
